data.title: Explore Lotus: Meaning, Origin & Popularity
data.meta_description: Lotus is a unique baby name with a floral connection and many more underlying meanings. Find out more on this title as you read further.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History Of Lotus

The name Lotus, derived from the lotus flower, is traced back to the Greek word lotos, referring to both the ‚Äòlotus flower‚Äô and the ‚Äòmythological lotus tree.‚Äô In Greek and Roman mythology, the lotus tree was known to produce a fruit that induced sleepiness and forgetfulness, adding a mystical and legendary aspect to this feminine name.

In Eastern religions, the lotus flower holds significant spiritual symbolism. In Hinduism and Buddhism, Lotus represents the path to spiritual awakening and enlightenment, symbolizing purity, beauty, and the unfolding of spiritual potential. This association imbues the name with a sense of spiritual depth and transcendence. It is also widely visible in Hindu religious iconography. In Christianity, the lotus flower is associated with the apostle Thomas and his journey to India, and it is also mentioned in the Bible, adding another layer to its religious significance.

Readers might be familiar with this baby title within the music industry. Lotus is the title of the seventh studio album by American singer-songwriter Christina Aguilera, released in 2012. In literature, The Blue Lotus is the fifth volume of The Adventures of Tintin by Belgian cartoonist Herg√©, adding a touch of literary and artistic dimension to this name.

Lotus has also been used as a personal name, although rarely. Lotus Long was a pioneering Asian-American actress who paved the way for future Asian-American actresses in Hollywood. She is best known for her role as Tokyo Rose in the 1946 film Tokyo Rose. The name is also associated with Flying Lotus, which is the stage name of rapper, DJ, and record producer Steven D. Bingley-Ellison.

Even though Lotus has not been widely used as a first name, it is an astute choice, rich with cultural connotations. It is a symbol of wisdom, enlightenment, and spirituality, yet because of its short and simple sound, is known for its air of modernity. If you are considering an unconventional floral name for your baby girl, Lotus may be the right choice.

How To Pronounce Lotus?

‚ÄòLotus‚Äô In QR Code

Lotus On The Popularity Chart

Societal influences, family traditions, latest trends, and timeless appeal are a few criteria that shape the choices of parents in naming their newest family members. In this section, we show you how the popularity of Lotus has trended over the years in the US, in absolute numbers (per million) as well as in its ranking.

Popularity Over Time

Lotus has witnessed a consistent upward trend over the years. Starting with 12 per million babies in 2000, it increased to 64 in 2009 and to 137 in 2021. This sustained rise indicates growing appeal and acceptance among parents.

As per the SSA, data covering the name Lotus spans 43 years, with the trend starting in 1980 and lasting until 2022. In 2023, the name reached its peak popularity, given to 138 in every million babies. The name had 137 records in 2021.

Source:

Rank Over Time

From 14,794th in 1993 to 6,205th in 2003 and 1,524th in 2021, the ranking of Lotus has been consistently growing. This indicates an increase in its popularity year after year.

Source:

Popularity Within US States

If you're living in the US, you might be curious about the popularity of Lotus in your own state, a state you're considering moving to, or one with which you have a connection. Use the drop-down menu below to select any US state and discover the name's popularity within that region.

California

Texas

Florida

Source:

Lotus Name‚Äôs Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Here is how Lotus fares on that count.

Lotus‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Lotus‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Lotus Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Lotus is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Lotus‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
